4133  d = unfilter(d);
4134  node.clear_coeff();
4135  node.set_has_children(true);
4136  for (KeyChildIterator<NDIM> kit(key); kit; ++kit) {
4137  const keyT& child = kit.key();
4138  coeffT ss = copy(d(child_patch(child)));
4139  ss.reduce_rank(targs.thresh);
4140  // coeffs.replace(child,nodeT(ss,-1.0,false).node_to_low_rank());
4141  coeffs.replace(child,nodeT(ss,-1.0,false));
4142  // Note value -1.0 for norm tree to indicate result of refinement
4143  }
4144  }
4145  }
4146 
4147  template <typename opT>
4148  void refine_spawn(const opT& op, const keyT& key) {
4149  nodeT& node = coeffs.find(key).get()->second;
4150  if (node.has_children()) {
4151  for (KeyChildIterator<NDIM> kit(key); kit; ++kit)
4152  woT::task(coeffs.owner(kit.key()), &implT:: template refine_spawn<opT>, op, kit.key(), TaskAttributes::hipri());
4153  }
4154  else {
4155  woT::task(coeffs.owner(key), &implT:: template refine_op<opT>, op, key);
4156  }
4157  }
4158 
4159  // Refine in real space according to local user-defined criterion
4160  template <typename opT>
4161  void refine(const opT& op, bool fence) {
4162  if (world.rank() == coeffs.owner(cdata.key0))
4163  woT::task(coeffs.owner(cdata.key0), &implT:: template refine_spawn<opT>, op, cdata.key0, TaskAttributes::hipri());
4164  if (fence)
4165  world.gop.fence();
4166  }
4167 
4168  bool exists_and_has_children(const keyT& key) const;
4169 
4170  bool exists_and_is_leaf(const keyT& key) const;
4171 
4172 
4173  void broaden_op(const keyT& key, const std::vector< Future <bool> >& v);
4174 
4175  // For each local node sets value of norm tree to 0.0
4176  void zero_norm_tree();
4177 
4178  // Broaden tree
4179  void broaden(std::vector<bool> is_periodic, bool fence);
4180 
4181  /// sum all the contributions from all scales after applying an operator in mod-NS form
4182  void trickle_down(bool fence);
4183 
4184  /// sum all the contributions from all scales after applying an operator in mod-NS form
4185 
4186  /// cf reconstruct_op
4187  void trickle_down_op(const keyT& key, const coeffT& s);
4188 
4189  void reconstruct(bool fence);
4190 
4191  // Invoked on node where key is local
4192  // void reconstruct_op(const keyT& key, const tensorT& s);
4193  void reconstruct_op(const keyT& key, const coeffT& s);
4194 
4195  /// compress the wave function
4196 
4197  /// after application there will be sum coefficients at the root level,
4198  /// and difference coefficients at all other levels; furthermore:
4199  /// @param[in] nonstandard keep sum coeffs at all other levels, except leaves
4200  /// @param[in] keepleaves keep sum coeffs (but no diff coeffs) at leaves
4201  /// @param[in] redundant keep only sum coeffs at all levels, discard difference coeffs
4202  void compress(bool nonstandard, bool keepleaves, bool redundant, bool fence);
4203 
4204  // Invoked on node where key is local
4205  Future<coeffT > compress_spawn(const keyT& key, bool nonstandard, bool keepleaves, bool redundant);
4206 
4207  /// convert this to redundant, i.e. have sum coefficients on all levels
4208  void make_redundant(const bool fence);
4209 
4210  /// convert this from redundant to standard reconstructed form
4211  void undo_redundant(const bool fence);
4212 
4213 
4214  /// compute for each FunctionNode the norm of the function inside that node
4215  void norm_tree(bool fence);
4216 
4217  double norm_tree_op(const keyT& key, const std::vector< Future<double> >& v);
4218 
4219  Future<double> norm_tree_spawn(const keyT& key);
4220 
4221  /// truncate using a tree in reconstructed form
4222 
4223  /// must be invoked where key is local
4224  Future<coeffT> truncate_reconstructed_spawn(const keyT& key, const double tol);
4225 
4226  /// given the sum coefficients of all children, truncate or not
4227 
4228  /// @return new sum coefficients (empty if internal, not empty, if new leaf); might delete its children
4229  coeffT truncate_reconstructed_op(const keyT& key, const std::vector< Future<coeffT > >& v, const double tol);
4230 
4231  /// calculate the wavelet coefficients using the sum coefficients of all child nodes
4232 
4233  /// @param[in] key this's key
4234  /// @param[in] v sum coefficients of the child nodes
4235  /// @param[in] nonstandard keep the sum coefficients with the wavelet coefficients
4236  /// @param[in] redundant keep only the sum coefficients, discard the wavelet coefficients
4237  /// @return the sum coefficients
4238  coeffT compress_op(const keyT& key, const std::vector< Future<coeffT > >& v, bool nonstandard, bool redundant);
4239 
4240 
4241  /// similar to compress_op, but insert only the sum coefficients in the tree
4242 
4243  /// @param[in] key this's key
4244  /// @param[in] v sum coefficients of the child nodes
4245  /// @return the sum coefficients
4246  coeffT make_redundant_op(const keyT& key, const std::vector< Future<coeffT > >& v);
4247 
4248  /// Changes non-standard compressed form to standard compressed form
4249  void standard(bool fence);
4250 
4251  /// Changes non-standard compressed form to standard compressed form
4252  struct do_standard {
4253  typedef Range<typename dcT::iterator> rangeT;
4254 
4255  // threshold for rank reduction / SVD truncation
4256  implT* impl;
4257 
4258  // constructor takes target precision
4259  do_standard() {}
4260  do_standard(implT* impl) : impl(impl) {}
4261 
4262  //
4263  bool operator()(typename rangeT::iterator& it) const {
4264 
4265  const keyT& key = it->first;
4266  nodeT& node = it->second;
4267  if (key.level()> 0 && node.has_coeff()) {
4268  if (node.has_children()) {
4269  // Zero out scaling coeffs
4270  node.coeff()(impl->cdata.s0)=0.0;
4271  node.reduceRank(impl->targs.thresh);
4272  } else {
4273  // Deleting both scaling and wavelet coeffs
4274  node.clear_coeff();
4275  }
4276  }
4277  return true;
4278  }
4279  template <typename Archive> void serialize(const Archive& ar) {
4280  MADNESS_EXCEPTION("no serialization of do_standard",1);
4281  }
4282  };
4283 
4284 
4285  /// laziness
4286  template<size_t OPDIM>
4287  struct do_op_args {
4288  Key<OPDIM> key,d;
4289  keyT dest;
4290  double tol, fac, cnorm;
4291  do_op_args() {}
4292  do_op_args(const Key<OPDIM>& key, const Key<OPDIM>& d, const keyT& dest, double tol, double fac, double cnorm)
4293  : key(key), d(d), dest(dest), tol(tol), fac(fac), cnorm(cnorm) {}
4294  template <class Archive>
4295  void serialize(Archive& ar) {
4296  ar & archive::wrap_opaque(this,1);
4297  }
4298  };
4299 
4300  /// for fine-grain parallelism: call the apply method of an operator in a separate task
4301 
4302  /// @param[in] op the operator working on our function
4303  /// @param[in] c full rank tensor holding the NS coefficients
4304  /// @param[in] args laziness holding norm of the coefficients, displacement, destination, ..
4305  template <typename opT, typename R, size_t OPDIM>
4306  void do_apply_kernel(const opT* op, const Tensor<R>& c, const do_op_args<OPDIM>& args) {
4307 
4308  tensorT result = op->apply(args.key, args.d, c, args.tol/args.fac/args.cnorm);
4309 
4310  // Screen here to reduce communication cost of negligible data
4311  // and also to ensure we don't needlessly widen the tree when
4312  // applying the operator
4313  if (result.normf()> 0.3*args.tol/args.fac) {
4314  Future<double> time=coeffs.task(args.dest, &nodeT::accumulate2, result, coeffs, args.dest, TaskAttributes::hipri());
4315  //woT::task(world.rank(),&implT::accumulate_timer,time,TaskAttributes::hipri());
4316  // UGLY BUT ADDED THE OPTIMIZATION BACK IN HERE EXPLICITLY/
4317  if (args.dest == world.rank()) {
4318  coeffs.send(args.dest, &nodeT::accumulate, result, coeffs, args.dest);
4319  }
4320  else {
4321  coeffs.task(args.dest, &nodeT::accumulate, result, coeffs, args.dest, TaskAttributes::hipri());
4322  }
4323  }
4324  }
4325 
4326  /// same as do_apply_kernel, but use full rank tensors as input and low rank tensors as output
4327 
4328  /// @param[in] op the operator working on our function
4329  /// @param[in] c full rank tensor holding the NS coefficients
4330  /// @param[in] args laziness holding norm of the coefficients, displacement, destination, ..
4331  /// @param[in] apply_targs TensorArgs with tightened threshold for accumulation
4332  /// @return nothing, but accumulate the result tensor into the destination node
4333  template <typename opT, typename R, size_t OPDIM>
4334  double do_apply_kernel2(const opT* op, const Tensor<R>& c, const do_op_args<OPDIM>& args,
4335  const TensorArgs& apply_targs) {
4336 
4337  tensorT result_full = op->apply(args.key, args.d, c, args.tol/args.fac/args.cnorm);
4338  const double norm=result_full.normf();
4339 
4340  // Screen here to reduce communication cost of negligible data
4341  // and also to ensure we don't needlessly widen the tree when
4342  // applying the operator
4343  // OPTIMIZATION NEEDED HERE ... CHANGING THIS TO TASK NOT SEND REMOVED
4344  // BUILTIN OPTIMIZATION TO SHORTCIRCUIT MSG IF DATA IS LOCAL
4345  if (norm > 0.3*args.tol/args.fac) {
4346 
4347  small++;
4348  //double cpu0=cpu_time();
4349  coeffT result=coeffT(result_full,apply_targs);
4350  MADNESS_ASSERT(result.tensor_type()==TT_FULL or result.tensor_type()==TT_2D);
4351  //double cpu1=cpu_time();
4352  //timer_lr_result.accumulate(cpu1-cpu0);
4353 
4354  Future<double> time=coeffs.task(args.dest, &nodeT::accumulate, result, coeffs, args.dest, apply_targs,
4355  TaskAttributes::hipri());
4356 
4357  //woT::task(world.rank(),&implT::accumulate_timer,time,TaskAttributes::hipri());
4358  }
4359  return norm;
4360  }
4361 
4362 
4363 
4364  /// same as do_apply_kernel2, but use low rank tensors as input and low rank tensors as output
4365 
4366  /// @param[in] op the operator working on our function
4367  /// @param[in] coeff full rank tensor holding the NS coefficients
4368  /// @param[in] args laziness holding norm of the coefficients, displacement, destination, ..
4369  /// @param[in] apply_targs TensorArgs with tightened threshold for accumulation
4370  /// @return nothing, but accumulate the result tensor into the destination node
4371  template <typename opT, typename R, size_t OPDIM>
4372  double do_apply_kernel3(const opT* op, const GenTensor<R>& coeff, const do_op_args<OPDIM>& args,
4373  const TensorArgs& apply_targs) {
4374 
4375  coeffT result;
4376  if (2*OPDIM==NDIM) result= op->apply2_lowdim(args.key, args.d, coeff,
4377  args.tol/args.fac/args.cnorm, args.tol/args.fac);
4378  if (OPDIM==NDIM) result = op->apply2(args.key, args.d, coeff,
4379  args.tol/args.fac/args.cnorm, args.tol/args.fac);
4380 
4381  const double result_norm=result.svd_normf();
4382 
4383  if (result_norm> 0.3*args.tol/args.fac) {
4384  small++;
4385 
4386  double cpu0=cpu_time();
4387  if (targs.tt!=result.tensor_type()) result=result.convert(targs);
4388  double cpu1=cpu_time();
4389  timer_lr_result.accumulate(cpu1-cpu0);
4390 
4391  // accumulate also expects result in SVD form
4392  Future<double> time=coeffs.task(args.dest, &nodeT::accumulate, result, coeffs, args.dest, apply_targs,
4393  TaskAttributes::hipri());
4394  woT::task(world.rank(),&implT::accumulate_timer,time,TaskAttributes::hipri());
4395 
4396  }
4397  return result_norm;
4398 
4399  }
4400 
4401  // volume of n-dimensional sphere of radius R
4402  double vol_nsphere(int n, double R) {
4403  return std::pow(madness::constants::pi,n*0.5)*std::pow(R,n)/std::tgamma(1+0.5*n);
4404  }
4405 
4406 
4407  /// apply an operator on the coeffs c (at node key)
4408 
4409  /// the result is accumulated inplace to this's tree at various FunctionNodes
4410  /// @param[in] op the operator to act on the source function
4411  /// @param[in] key key of the source FunctionNode of f which is processed
4412  /// @param[in] c coeffs of the FunctionNode of f which is processed
4413  template <typename opT, typename R>
4414  void do_apply(const opT* op, const keyT& key, const Tensor<R>& c) {
4415  PROFILE_MEMBER_FUNC(FunctionImpl);
4416 
4417  // working assumption here WAS that the operator is
4418  // isotropic and montonically decreasing with distance
4419  // ... however, now we are using derivative Gaussian
4420  // expansions (and also non-cubic boxes) isotropic is
4421  // violated. While not strictly monotonically decreasing,
4422  // the derivative gaussian is still such that once it
4423  // becomes negligible we are in the asymptotic region.
4424 
4425  typedef typename opT::keyT opkeyT;
4426  static const size_t opdim=opT::opdim;
4427  const opkeyT source=op->get_source_key(key);
4428 
4429 
4430  // Tuning here is based on observation that with
4431  // sufficiently high-order wavelet relative to the
4432  // precision, that only nearest neighbor boxes contribute,
4433  // whereas for low-order wavelets more neighbors will
4434  // contribute. Sufficiently high is picked as
4435  // k>=2-log10(eps) which is our empirical rule for
4436  // efficiency/accuracy and code instrumentation has
4437  // previously indicated that (in 3D) just unit
4438  // displacements are invoked. The error decays as R^-(k+1),
4439  // and the number of boxes increases as R^d.
4440  //
4441  // Fac is the expected number of contributions to a given
4442  // box, so the error permitted per contribution will be
4443  // tol/fac
4444 
4445  // radius of shell (nearest neighbor is diameter of 3 boxes, so radius=1.5)
4446  double radius = 1.5 + 0.33*std::max(0.0,2-std::log10(thresh)-k); // 0.33 was 0.5
4447  double fac = vol_nsphere(NDIM, radius);
4448  //previously fac=10.0 selected empirically constrained by qmprop
4449 
4450  double cnorm = c.normf();
4451 
4452  const std::vector<opkeyT>& disp = op->get_disp(key.level()); // list of displacements sorted in orer of increasing distance
4453  const std::vector<bool> is_periodic(NDIM,false); // Periodic sum is already done when making rnlp
4454  int ndone=1; // Counts #done at each distance
4455  uint64_t distsq = 99999999999999;
4456  for (typename std::vector<opkeyT>::const_iterator it=disp.begin(); it != disp.end(); ++it) {
4457  keyT d;
4458  Key<NDIM-opdim> nullkey(key.level());
4459  if (op->particle()==1) d=it->merge_with(nullkey);
4460  if (op->particle()==2) d=nullkey.merge_with(*it);
4461 
4462  uint64_t dsq = d.distsq();
4463  if (dsq != distsq) { // Moved to next shell of neighbors
4464  if (ndone == 0 && dsq > 1) {
4465  // Have at least done the input box and all first
4466  // nearest neighbors, and for all of the last set
4467  // of neighbors had no contribution. Thus,
4468  // assuming monotonic decrease, we are done.
4469  break;
4470  }
4471  ndone = 0;
4472  distsq = dsq;
4473  }
4474 
4475  keyT dest = neighbor(key, d, is_periodic);
4476  if (dest.is_valid()) {
4477  double opnorm = op->norm(key.level(), *it, source);
4478  double tol = truncate_tol(thresh, key);
4479 
4480  if (cnorm*opnorm> tol/fac) {
4481  ndone++;
4482  tensorT result = op->apply(source, *it, c, tol/fac/cnorm);
4483  if (result.normf() > 0.3*tol/fac) {
4484  if (coeffs.is_local(dest))
4485  coeffs.send(dest, &nodeT::accumulate2, result, coeffs, dest);
4486  else
4487  coeffs.task(dest, &nodeT::accumulate2, result, coeffs, dest);
4488  }
4489  }
4490  }
4491  }
4492  }
4493 
4494 
4495  /// apply an operator on f to return this
4496  template <typename opT, typename R>
4497  void apply(opT& op, const FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>& f, bool fence) {
4498  PROFILE_MEMBER_FUNC(FunctionImpl);
4499  MADNESS_ASSERT(!op.modified());
4500  typename dcT::const_iterator end = f.coeffs.end();
4501  for (typename dcT::const_iterator it=f.coeffs.begin(); it!=end; ++it) {
4502  // looping through all the coefficients in the source
4503  const keyT& key = it->first;
4504  const FunctionNode<R,NDIM>& node = it->second;
4505  if (node.has_coeff()) {
4506  if (node.coeff().dim(0) != k || op.doleaves) {
4507  ProcessID p = FunctionDefaults<NDIM>::get_apply_randomize() ? world.random_proc() : coeffs.owner(key);
4508 // woT::task(p, &implT:: template do_apply<opT,R>, &op, key, node.coeff()); //.full_tensor_copy() ????? why copy ????
4509  woT::task(p, &implT:: template do_apply<opT,R>, &op, key, node.coeff().reconstruct_tensor());
4510  }
4511  }
4512  }
4513  if (fence)
4514  world.gop.fence();
4515 
4516  this->compressed=true;
4517  this->nonstandard=true;
4518  this->redundant=false;
4519 
4520  }
4521 
4522 
4523 
4524  /// apply an operator on the coeffs c (at node key)
4525 
4526  /// invoked by result; the result is accumulated inplace to this's tree at various FunctionNodes
4527  /// @param[in] op the operator to act on the source function
4528  /// @param[in] key key of the source FunctionNode of f which is processed (see "source")
4529  /// @param[in] coeff coeffs of FunctionNode being processed
4530  /// @param[in] do_kernel true: do the 0-disp only; false: do everything but the kernel
4531  /// @return max norm, and will modify or include new nodes in this' tree
4532  template <typename opT, typename R>
4533  double do_apply_directed_screening(const opT* op, const keyT& key, const coeffT& coeff,
4534  const bool& do_kernel) {
4535  PROFILE_MEMBER_FUNC(FunctionImpl);
4536  // insert timer here
4537  typedef typename opT::keyT opkeyT;
4538 
4539  // screening: contains all displacement keys that had small result norms
4540  std::list<opkeyT> blacklist;
4541 
4542  static const size_t opdim=opT::opdim;
4543  Key<NDIM-opdim> nullkey(key.level());
4544 
4545  // source is that part of key that corresponds to those dimensions being processed
4546  const opkeyT source=op->get_source_key(key);
4547 
4548  const double tol = truncate_tol(thresh, key);
4549 
4550  // fac is the root of the number of contributing neighbors (1st shell)
4551  double fac=std::pow(3,NDIM*0.5);
4552  double cnorm = coeff.normf();
4553 
4554  // for accumulation: keep slightly tighter TensorArgs
4555  TensorArgs apply_targs(targs);
4556  apply_targs.thresh=tol/fac*0.03;
4557 
4558  double maxnorm=0.0;
4559 
4560  // for the kernel it may be more efficient to do the convolution in full rank
4561  tensorT coeff_full;
4562  // for partial application (exchange operator) it's more efficient to
4563  // do SVD tensors instead of tensortrains, because addition in apply
4564  // can be done in full form for the specific particle
4565  coeffT coeff_SVD=coeff.convert(TensorArgs(-1.0,TT_2D));
4566 #ifdef USE_LRT
4567  coeff_SVD.impl.svd->orthonormalize(tol*LowRankTensor<T>::fac_reduce());
4568 #endif
4569 
4570  const std::vector<opkeyT>& disp = op->get_disp(key.level());
4571  const std::vector<bool> is_periodic(NDIM,false); // Periodic sum is already done when making rnlp
4572 
4573  for (typename std::vector<opkeyT>::const_iterator it=disp.begin(); it != disp.end(); ++it) {
4574  const opkeyT& d = *it;
4575 
4576  const int shell=d.distsq();
4577  if (do_kernel and (shell>0)) break;
4578  if ((not do_kernel) and (shell==0)) continue;
4579 
4580  keyT disp1;
4581  if (op->particle()==1) disp1=it->merge_with(nullkey);
4582  else if (op->particle()==2) disp1=nullkey.merge_with(*it);
4583  else {
4584  MADNESS_EXCEPTION("confused particle in operato??",1);
4585  }
4586 
4587  keyT dest = neighbor(key, disp1, is_periodic);
4588 
4589  if (not dest.is_valid()) continue;
4590 
4591  // directed screening
4592  // working assumption here is that the operator is isotropic and
4593  // monotonically decreasing with distance
4594  bool screened=false;
4595  typename std::list<opkeyT>::const_iterator it2;
4596  for (it2=blacklist.begin(); it2!=blacklist.end(); it2++) {
4597  if (d.is_farther_out_than(*it2)) {
4598  screened=true;
4599  break;
4600  }
4601  }
4602  if (not screened) {
4603 
4604  double opnorm = op->norm(key.level(), d, source);
4605  double norm=0.0;
4606 
4607  if (cnorm*opnorm> tol/fac) {
4608 
4609  double cost_ratio=op->estimate_costs(source, d, coeff_SVD, tol/fac/cnorm, tol/fac);
4610  // cost_ratio=1.5; // force low rank
4611  // cost_ratio=0.5; // force full rank
4612 
4613  if (cost_ratio>0.0) {
4614 
4615  do_op_args<opdim> args(source, d, dest, tol, fac, cnorm);
4616  norm=0.0;
4617  if (cost_ratio<1.0) {
4618  if (not coeff_full.has_data()) coeff_full=coeff.full_tensor_copy();
4619  norm=do_apply_kernel2(op, coeff_full,args,apply_targs);
4620  } else {
4621  if (2*opdim==NDIM) { // apply operator on one particle only
4622  norm=do_apply_kernel3(op,coeff_SVD,args,apply_targs);
4623  } else {
4624  norm=do_apply_kernel3(op,coeff,args,apply_targs);
4625  }
4626  }
4627  maxnorm=std::max(norm,maxnorm);
4628  }
4629 
4630  } else if (shell >= 12) {
4631  break; // Assumes monotonic decay beyond nearest neighbor
4632  }
4633  if (norm<0.3*tol/fac) blacklist.push_back(d);
4634  }
4635  }
4636  return maxnorm;
4637  }
4638 
4639 
4640  /// similar to apply, but for low rank coeffs
4641  template <typename opT, typename R>
4642  void apply_source_driven(opT& op, const FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>& f, bool fence) {
4643  PROFILE_MEMBER_FUNC(FunctionImpl);
4644 
4645  MADNESS_ASSERT(not op.modified());
4646  // looping through all the coefficients of the source f
4647  typename dcT::const_iterator end = f.get_coeffs().end();
4648  for (typename dcT::const_iterator it=f.get_coeffs().begin(); it!=end; ++it) {
4649 
4650  const keyT& key = it->first;
4651  const coeffT& coeff = it->second.coeff();
4652 
4653  if (coeff.has_data() and (coeff.rank()!=0)) {
4654  ProcessID p = FunctionDefaults<NDIM>::get_apply_randomize() ? world.random_proc() : coeffs.owner(key);
4655  woT::task(p, &implT:: template do_apply_directed_screening<opT,R>, &op, key, coeff, true);
4656  woT::task(p, &implT:: template do_apply_directed_screening<opT,R>, &op, key, coeff, false);
4657  }
4658  }
4659  if (fence) world.gop.fence();
4660  }
4661 
4662  /// after apply we need to do some cleanup;
4663  double finalize_apply(const bool fence=true);
4664 
4665  /// traverse a non-existing tree, make its coeffs and apply an operator
4666 
4667  /// invoked by result
4668  /// here we use the fact that the hi-dim NS coefficients on all scales are exactly
4669  /// the outer product of the underlying low-dim functions (also in NS form),
4670  /// so we don't need to construct the full hi-dim tree and then turn it into NS form.
4671  /// @param[in] apply_op the operator acting on the NS tree
4672  /// @param[in] fimpl the funcimpl of the function of particle 1
4673  /// @param[in] gimpl the funcimpl of the function of particle 2
4674  template<typename opT, std::size_t LDIM>
4675  void recursive_apply(opT& apply_op, const FunctionImpl<T,LDIM>* fimpl,
4676  const FunctionImpl<T,LDIM>* gimpl, const bool fence) {
4677 
4678  //print("IN RECUR2");
4679  const keyT& key0=cdata.key0;
4680 
4681  if (world.rank() == coeffs.owner(key0)) {
4682 
4683  CoeffTracker<T,LDIM> ff(fimpl);
4684  CoeffTracker<T,LDIM> gg(gimpl);
4685 
4686  typedef recursive_apply_op<opT,LDIM> coeff_opT;
4687  coeff_opT coeff_op(this,ff,gg,&apply_op);
4688 
4689  typedef noop<T,NDIM> apply_opT;
4690  apply_opT apply_op;
4691 
4692  ProcessID p= coeffs.owner(key0);
4693  woT::task(p, &implT:: template forward_traverse<coeff_opT,apply_opT>, coeff_op, apply_op, key0);
4694 
4695  }
4696  if (fence) world.gop.fence();
4697  }
4698 
4699  /// recursive part of recursive_apply
4700  template<typename opT, std::size_t LDIM>
4701  struct recursive_apply_op {
4702  bool randomize() const {return true;}
4703 
4704  typedef recursive_apply_op<opT,LDIM> this_type;
4705 
4706  implT* result;
4707  CoeffTracker<T,LDIM> iaf;
4708  CoeffTracker<T,LDIM> iag;
4709  opT* apply_op;
4710 
4711  // ctor
4712  recursive_apply_op() {}
4713  recursive_apply_op(implT* result,
4714  const CoeffTracker<T,LDIM>& iaf, const CoeffTracker<T,LDIM>& iag,
4715  const opT* apply_op) : result(result), iaf(iaf), iag(iag), apply_op(apply_op)
4716  {
4717  MADNESS_ASSERT(LDIM+LDIM==NDIM);
4718  }
4719  recursive_apply_op(const recursive_apply_op& other) : result(other.result), iaf(other.iaf),
4720  iag(other.iag), apply_op(other.apply_op) {}
4721 
4722 
4723  /// make the NS-coefficients and send off the application of the operator
4724 
4725  /// @return a Future<bool,coeffT>(is_leaf,coeffT())
4726  std::pair<bool,coeffT> operator()(const Key<NDIM>& key) const {
4727 
4728  // World& world=result->world;
4729  // break key into particles (these are the child keys, with datum1/2 come the parent keys)
4730  Key<LDIM> key1,key2;
4731  key.break_apart(key1,key2);
4732 
4733  // the lo-dim functions should be in full tensor form
4734  const tensorT fcoeff=iaf.coeff(key1).full_tensor();
4735  const tensorT gcoeff=iag.coeff(key2).full_tensor();
4736 
4737  // would this be a leaf node? If so, then its sum coeffs have already been
4738  // processed by the parent node's wavelet coeffs. Therefore we won't
4739  // process it any more.
4740  hartree_leaf_op<T,NDIM> leaf_op(result,result->get_k());
4741  bool is_leaf=leaf_op(key,fcoeff,gcoeff);
4742 
4743  if (not is_leaf) {
4744  // new coeffs are simply the hartree/kronecker/outer product --
4745  const std::vector<Slice>& s0=iaf.get_impl()->cdata.s0;
4746  const coeffT coeff = (apply_op->modified())
4747  ? outer(copy(fcoeff(s0)),copy(gcoeff(s0)),result->targs)
4748  : outer(fcoeff,gcoeff,result->targs);
4749 
4750  // now send off the application
4751  tensorT coeff_full;
4752  ProcessID p=result->world.rank();
4753  double norm0=result->do_apply_directed_screening<opT,T>(apply_op, key, coeff, true);
4754 
4755  result->task(p,&implT:: template do_apply_directed_screening<opT,T>,
4756  apply_op,key,coeff,false);
4757 
4758  return finalize(norm0,key,coeff);
4759 
4760  } else {
4761  return std::pair<bool,coeffT> (is_leaf,coeffT());
4762  }
4763  }
4764 
4765  /// sole purpose is to wait for the kernel norm, wrap it and send it back to caller
4766  std::pair<bool,coeffT> finalize(const double kernel_norm, const keyT& key,
4767  const coeffT& coeff) const {
4768  const double thresh=result->get_thresh()*0.1;
4769  bool is_leaf=(kernel_norm<result->truncate_tol(thresh,key));
4770  if (key.level()<2) is_leaf=false;
4771  return std::pair<bool,coeffT> (is_leaf,coeff);
4772  }
4773 
4774 
4775  this_type make_child(const keyT& child) const {
4776 
4777  // break key into particles
4778  Key<LDIM> key1, key2;
4779  child.break_apart(key1,key2);
4780 
4781  return this_type(result,iaf.make_child(key1),iag.make_child(key2),apply_op);
4782  }
4783 
4784  Future<this_type> activate() const {
4785  Future<CoeffTracker<T,LDIM> > f1=iaf.activate();
4786  Future<CoeffTracker<T,LDIM> > g1=iag.activate();
4787  return result->world.taskq.add(detail::wrap_mem_fn(*const_cast<this_type *> (this),
4788  &this_type::forward_ctor),result,f1,g1,apply_op);
4789  }
4790 
4791  this_type forward_ctor(implT* r, const CoeffTracker<T,LDIM>& f1, const CoeffTracker<T,LDIM>& g1,
4792  const opT* apply_op1) {
4793  return this_type(r,f1,g1,apply_op1);
4794  }
4795 
4796  template <typename Archive> void serialize(const Archive& ar) {
4797  ar & result & iaf & iag & apply_op;
4798  }
4799  };
4800 
4801  /// traverse an existing tree and apply an operator
4802 
4803  /// invoked by result
4804  /// @param[in] apply_op the operator acting on the NS tree
4805  /// @param[in] fimpl the funcimpl of the source function
4806  /// @param[in] rimpl a dummy function for recursive_op to insert data
4807  template<typename opT>
4808  void recursive_apply(opT& apply_op, const implT* fimpl, implT* rimpl, const bool fence) {
4809 
4810  print("IN RECUR1");
4811 
4812  const keyT& key0=cdata.key0;
4813 
4814  if (world.rank() == coeffs.owner(key0)) {
4815 
4816  typedef recursive_apply_op2<opT> coeff_opT;
4817  coeff_opT coeff_op(this,fimpl,&apply_op);
4818 
4819  typedef noop<T,NDIM> apply_opT;
4820  apply_opT apply_op;
4821 
4822  woT::task(world.rank(), &implT:: template forward_traverse<coeff_opT,apply_opT>,
4823  coeff_op, apply_op, cdata.key0);
4824 
4825  }
4826  if (fence) world.gop.fence();
4827  }
4828 
4829  /// recursive part of recursive_apply
4830  template<typename opT>
4831  struct recursive_apply_op2 {
4832  bool randomize() const {return true;}
4833 
4834  typedef recursive_apply_op2<opT> this_type;
4835  typedef CoeffTracker<T,NDIM> ctT;
4836  typedef std::pair<bool,coeffT> argT;
4837 
4838  mutable implT* result;
4839  ctT iaf; /// need this for randomization
4840  const opT* apply_op;
4841 
4842  // ctor
4843  recursive_apply_op2() {}
4844  recursive_apply_op2(implT* result, const ctT& iaf, const opT* apply_op)
4845  : result(result), iaf(iaf), apply_op(apply_op) {}
4846 
4847  recursive_apply_op2(const recursive_apply_op2& other) : result(other.result),
4848  iaf(other.iaf), apply_op(other.apply_op) {}
4849 
4850 
4851  /// send off the application of the operator
4852 
4853  /// the first (core) neighbor (ie. the box itself) is processed
4854  /// immediately, all other ones are shoved into the taskq
4855  /// @return a pair<bool,coeffT>(is_leaf,coeffT())
4856  argT operator()(const Key<NDIM>& key) const {
4857 
4858  const coeffT& coeff=iaf.coeff();
4859 
4860  if (coeff.has_data()) {
4861 
4862  // now send off the application for all neighbor boxes
4863  ProcessID p=result->world.rank();
4864  result->task(p,&implT:: template do_apply_directed_screening<opT,T>,
4865  apply_op, key, coeff, false);
4866 
4867  // process the core box
4868  double norm0=result->do_apply_directed_screening<opT,T>(apply_op,key,coeff,true);
4869 
4870  if (iaf.is_leaf()) return argT(true,coeff);
4871  return finalize(norm0,key,coeff,result);
4872 
4873  } else {
4874  const bool is_leaf=true;
4875  return argT(is_leaf,coeffT());
4876  }
4877  }
4878 
4879  /// sole purpose is to wait for the kernel norm, wrap it and send it back to caller
4880  argT finalize(const double kernel_norm, const keyT& key,
4881  const coeffT& coeff, const implT* r) const {
4882  const double thresh=r->get_thresh()*0.1;
4883  bool is_leaf=(kernel_norm<r->truncate_tol(thresh,key));
4884  if (key.level()<2) is_leaf=false;
4885  return argT(is_leaf,coeff);
4886  }
4887 
4888 
4889  this_type make_child(const keyT& child) const {
4890  return this_type(result,iaf.make_child(child),apply_op);
4891  }
4892 
4893  /// retrieve the coefficients (parent coeffs might be remote)
4894  Future<this_type> activate() const {
4895  Future<ctT> f1=iaf.activate();
4896 
4897 // Future<ctL> g1=g.activate();
4898 // return h->world.taskq.add(detail::wrap_mem_fn(*const_cast<this_type *> (this),
4899 // &this_type::forward_ctor),h,f1,g1,particle);
4900 
4901  return result->world.taskq.add(detail::wrap_mem_fn(*const_cast<this_type *> (this),
4902  &this_type::forward_ctor),result,f1,apply_op);
4903  }
4904 
4905  /// taskq-compatible ctor
4906  this_type forward_ctor(implT* result1, const ctT& iaf1, const opT* apply_op1) {
4907  return this_type(result1,iaf1,apply_op1);
4908  }
4909 
4910  template <typename Archive> void serialize(const Archive& ar) {
4911  ar & result & iaf & apply_op;
4912  }
4913  };
4914 
4915  /// Returns the square of the error norm in the box labeled by key
4916 
4917  /// Assumed to be invoked locally but it would be easy to eliminate
4918  /// this assumption
4919  template <typename opT>
4920  double err_box(const keyT& key, const nodeT& node, const opT& func,
4921  int npt, const Tensor<double>& qx, const Tensor<double>& quad_phit,
4922  const Tensor<double>& quad_phiw) const {
4923 
4924  std::vector<long> vq(NDIM);
4925  for (std::size_t i=0; i<NDIM; ++i)
4926  vq[i] = npt;
4927  tensorT fval(vq,false), work(vq,false), result(vq,false);
4928 
4929  // Compute the "exact" function in this volume at npt points
4930  // where npt is usually this->npt+1.
4931  fcube(key, func, qx, fval);
4932 
4933  // Transform into the scaling function basis of order npt
4934  double scale = pow(0.5,0.5*NDIM*key.level())*sqrt(FunctionDefaults<NDIM>::get_cell_volume());
4935  fval = fast_transform(fval,quad_phiw,result,work).scale(scale);
4936 
4937  // Subtract to get the error ... the original coeffs are in the order k
4938  // basis but we just computed the coeffs in the order npt(=k+1) basis
4939  // so we can either use slices or an iterator macro.
4940  const tensorT coeff = node.coeff().full_tensor_copy();
4941  ITERATOR(coeff,fval(IND)-=coeff(IND););
4942  // flo note: we do want to keep a full tensor here!
4943 
4944  // Compute the norm of what remains
4945  double err = fval.normf();
4946  return err*err;
4947  }
4948 
4949  template <typename opT>
4950  class do_err_box {
4951  const implT* impl;
4952  const opT* func;
4953  int npt;
4954  Tensor<double> qx;
4955  Tensor<double> quad_phit;
4956  Tensor<double> quad_phiw;
4957  public:
4958  do_err_box() {}
4959 
4960  do_err_box(const implT* impl, const opT* func, int npt, const Tensor<double>& qx,
4961  const Tensor<double>& quad_phit, const Tensor<double>& quad_phiw)
4962  : impl(impl), func(func), npt(npt), qx(qx), quad_phit(quad_phit), quad_phiw(quad_phiw) {}
4963 
4964  do_err_box(const do_err_box& e)
4965  : impl(e.impl), func(e.func), npt(e.npt), qx(e.qx), quad_phit(e.quad_phit), quad_phiw(e.quad_phiw) {}
4966 
4967  double operator()(typename dcT::const_iterator& it) const {
4968  const keyT& key = it->first;
4969  const nodeT& node = it->second;
4970  if (node.has_coeff())
4971  return impl->err_box(key, node, *func, npt, qx, quad_phit, quad_phiw);
4972  else
4973  return 0.0;
4974  }
4975 
4976  double operator()(double a, double b) const {
4977  return a+b;
4978  }
4979 
4980  template <typename Archive>
4981  void serialize(const Archive& ar) {
4982  throw "not yet";
4983  }
4984  };
4985 
4986  /// Returns the sum of squares of errors from local info ... no comms
4987  template <typename opT>
4988  double errsq_local(const opT& func) const {
4989  PROFILE_MEMBER_FUNC(FunctionImpl);
4990  // Make quadrature rule of higher order
4991  const int npt = cdata.npt + 1;
4992  Tensor<double> qx, qw, quad_phi, quad_phiw, quad_phit;
4993  FunctionCommonData<T,NDIM>::_init_quadrature(k+1, npt, qx, qw, quad_phi, quad_phiw, quad_phit);
4994 
4995  typedef Range<typename dcT::const_iterator> rangeT;
4996  rangeT range(coeffs.begin(), coeffs.end());
4997  return world.taskq.reduce< double,rangeT,do_err_box<opT> >(range,
4998  do_err_box<opT>(this, &func, npt, qx, quad_phit, quad_phiw));
4999  }
5000 
5001  /// Returns \c int(f(x),x) in local volume
5002  T trace_local() const;
5003 
5004  struct do_norm2sq_local {
5005  double operator()(typename dcT::const_iterator& it) const {
5006  const nodeT& node = it->second;
5007  if (node.has_coeff()) {
5008  double norm = node.coeff().normf();
5009  return norm*norm;
5010  }
5011  else {
5012  return 0.0;
5013  }
5014  }
5015 
5016  double operator()(double a, double b) const {
5017  return (a+b);
5018  }
5019 
5020  template <typename Archive> void serialize(const Archive& ar) {
5021  throw "NOT IMPLEMENTED";
5022  }
5023  };
5024 
5025 
5026  /// Returns the square of the local norm ... no comms
5027  double norm2sq_local() const;
5028 
5029  /// compute the inner product of this range with other
5030  template<typename R>
5031  struct do_inner_local {
5032  const FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>* other;
5033  bool leaves_only;
5034  typedef TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) resultT;
5035 
5036  do_inner_local(const FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>* other, const bool leaves_only)
5037  : other(other), leaves_only(leaves_only) {}
5038  resultT operator()(typename dcT::const_iterator& it) const {
5039 
5040  TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) sum=0.0;
5041  const keyT& key=it->first;
5042  const nodeT& fnode = it->second;
5043  if (fnode.has_coeff()) {
5044  if (other->coeffs.probe(it->first)) {
5045  const FunctionNode<R,NDIM>& gnode = other->coeffs.find(key).get()->second;
5046  if (gnode.has_coeff()) {
5047  if (gnode.coeff().dim(0) != fnode.coeff().dim(0)) {
5048  madness::print("INNER", it->first, gnode.coeff().dim(0),fnode.coeff().dim(0));
5049  MADNESS_EXCEPTION("functions have different k or compress/reconstruct error", 0);
5050  }
5051  if (leaves_only) {
5052  if (gnode.is_leaf() or fnode.is_leaf()) {
5053  sum += fnode.coeff().trace_conj(gnode.coeff());
5054  }
5055  } else {
5056  sum += fnode.coeff().trace_conj(gnode.coeff());
5057  }
5058  }
5059  }
5060  }
5061  return sum;
5062  }
5063 
5064  resultT operator()(resultT a, resultT b) const {
5065  return (a+b);
5066  }
5067 
5068  template <typename Archive> void serialize(const Archive& ar) {
5069  throw "NOT IMPLEMENTED";
5070  }
5071  };
5072 
5073  /// Returns the inner product ASSUMING same distribution
5074 
5075  /// handles compressed and redundant form
5076  template <typename R>
5077  TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) inner_local(const FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>& g) const {
5078  PROFILE_MEMBER_FUNC(FunctionImpl);
5079  typedef Range<typename dcT::const_iterator> rangeT;
5080  typedef TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) resultT;
5081 
5082  // make sure the states of the trees are consistent
5083  MADNESS_ASSERT(this->is_redundant()==g.is_redundant());
5084  bool leaves_only=(this->is_redundant());
5085  return world.taskq.reduce<resultT,rangeT,do_inner_local<R> >
5086  (rangeT(coeffs.begin(),coeffs.end()),do_inner_local<R>(&g, leaves_only));
5087  }
5088 
5089  /// Type of the entry in the map returned by make_key_vec_map
5090  typedef std::vector< std::pair<int,const coeffT*> > mapvecT;
5091 
5092  /// Type of the map returned by make_key_vec_map
5093  typedef ConcurrentHashMap< keyT, mapvecT > mapT;
5094 
5095  /// Adds keys to union of local keys with specified index
5096  void add_keys_to_map(mapT* map, int index) const {
5097  typename dcT::const_iterator end = coeffs.end();
5098  for (typename dcT::const_iterator it=coeffs.begin(); it!=end; ++it) {
5099  typename mapT::accessor acc;
5100  const keyT& key = it->first;
5101  const FunctionNode<T,NDIM>& node = it->second;
5102  if (node.has_coeff()) {
5103  map->insert(acc,key);
5104  acc->second.push_back(std::make_pair(index,&(node.coeff())));
5105  }
5106  }
5107  }
5108 
5109  /// Returns map of union of local keys to vector of indexes of functions containing that key
5110 
5111  /// Local concurrency and synchronization only; no communication
5112  static
5113  mapT
5114  make_key_vec_map(const std::vector<const FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>*>& v) {
5115  mapT map(100000);
5116  // This loop must be parallelized
5117  for (unsigned int i=0; i<v.size(); i++) {
5118  //v[i]->add_keys_to_map(&map,i);
5119  v[i]->world.taskq.add(*(v[i]), &FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>::add_keys_to_map, &map, int(i));
5120  }
5121  if (v.size()) v[0]->world.taskq.fence();
5122  return map;
5123  }
5124 
5125 #if HAVE_GENTENSOR
5126 // Original
5127  template <typename R>
5128  static void do_inner_localX(const typename mapT::iterator lstart,
5129  const typename mapT::iterator lend,
5130  typename FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>::mapT* rmap_ptr,
5131  const bool sym,
5132  Tensor< TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) >* result_ptr,
5133  Mutex* mutex) {
5134  Tensor< TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) >& result = *result_ptr;
5135  Tensor< TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) > r(result.dim(0),result.dim(1));
5136  for (typename mapT::iterator lit=lstart; lit!=lend; ++lit) {
5137  const keyT& key = lit->first;
5138  typename FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>::mapT::iterator rit=rmap_ptr->find(key);
5139  if (rit != rmap_ptr->end()) {
5140  const mapvecT& leftv = lit->second;
5141  const typename FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>::mapvecT& rightv =rit->second;
5142  const int nleft = leftv.size();
5143  const int nright= rightv.size();
5144 
5145  for (int iv=0; iv<nleft; iv++) {
5146  const int i = leftv[iv].first;
5147  const GenTensor<T>* iptr = leftv[iv].second;
5148 
5149  for (int jv=0; jv<nright; jv++) {
5150  const int j = rightv[jv].first;
5151  const GenTensor<R>* jptr = rightv[jv].second;
5152 
5153  if (!sym || (sym && i<=j))
5154  r(i,j) += iptr->trace_conj(*jptr);
5155  }
5156  }
5157  }
5158  }
5159  mutex->lock();
5160  result += r;
5161  mutex->unlock();
5162  }
5163 #else
5164  template <typename R>
5165  static void do_inner_localX(const typename mapT::iterator lstart,
5166  const typename mapT::iterator lend,
5167  typename FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>::mapT* rmap_ptr,
5168  const bool sym,
5169  Tensor< TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) >* result_ptr,
5170  Mutex* mutex) {
5171  Tensor< TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) >& result = *result_ptr;
5172  //Tensor< TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) > r(result.dim(0),result.dim(1));
5173  for (typename mapT::iterator lit=lstart; lit!=lend; ++lit) {
5174  const keyT& key = lit->first;
5175  typename FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>::mapT::iterator rit=rmap_ptr->find(key);
5176  if (rit != rmap_ptr->end()) {
5177  const mapvecT& leftv = lit->second;
5178  const typename FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>::mapvecT& rightv =rit->second;
5179  const size_t nleft = leftv.size();
5180  const size_t nright= rightv.size();
5181 
5182  unsigned int size = leftv[0].second->size();
5183  Tensor<T> Left(nleft, size);
5184  Tensor<R> Right(nright, size);
5185  Tensor< TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R)> r(nleft, nright);
5186  for(unsigned int iv = 0; iv < nleft; ++iv) Left(iv,_) = *(leftv[iv].second);
5187  for(unsigned int jv = 0; jv < nright; ++jv) Right(jv,_) = *(rightv[jv].second);
5188  // call mxmT from mxm.h in tensor
5189  if(TensorTypeData<T>::iscomplex) Left = Left.conj(); //Should handle complex case and leave real case alone
5190  mxmT(nleft, nright, size, r.ptr(), Left.ptr(), Right.ptr());
5191  mutex->lock();
5192  for(unsigned int iv = 0; iv < nleft; ++iv) {
5193  const int i = leftv[iv].first;
5194  for(unsigned int jv = 0; jv < nright; ++jv) {
5195  const int j = rightv[jv].first;
5196  if (!sym || (sym && i<=j)) result(i,j) += r(iv,jv);
5197  }
5198  }
5199  mutex->unlock();
5200  }
5201  }
5202  }
5203 #endif
5204 
5205  static double conj(float x) {
5206  return x;
5207  }
5208 
5209  static std::complex<double> conj(const std::complex<double> x) {
5210  return std::conj(x);
5211  }
5212 
5213  template <typename R>
5214  static Tensor< TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) >
5215  inner_local(const std::vector<const FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>*>& left,
5216  const std::vector<const FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>*>& right,
5217  bool sym) {
5218 
5219  // This is basically a sparse matrix^T * matrix product
5220  // Rij = sum(k) Aki * Bkj
5221  // where i and j index functions and k index the wavelet coeffs
5222  // eventually the goal is this structure (don't have jtile yet)
5223  //
5224  // do in parallel tiles of k (tensors of coeffs)
5225  // do tiles of j
5226  // do i
5227  // do j in jtile
5228  // do k in ktile
5229  // Rij += Aki*Bkj
5230 
5231  mapT lmap = make_key_vec_map(left);
5232  typename FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>::mapT rmap;
5233  typename FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>::mapT* rmap_ptr = (typename FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>::mapT*)(&lmap);
5234  if ((std::vector<const FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>*>*)(&left) != &right) {
5235  rmap = FunctionImpl<R,NDIM>::make_key_vec_map(right);
5236  rmap_ptr = &rmap;
5237  }
5238 
5239  size_t chunk = (lmap.size()-1)/(3*4*5)+1;
5240 
5241  Tensor< TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) > r(left.size(), right.size());
5242  Mutex mutex;
5243 
5244  typename mapT::iterator lstart=lmap.begin();
5245  while (lstart != lmap.end()) {
5246  typename mapT::iterator lend = lstart;
5247  advance(lend,chunk);
5248  left[0]->world.taskq.add(&FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>::do_inner_localX<R>, lstart, lend, rmap_ptr, sym, &r, &mutex);
5249  lstart = lend;
5250  }
5251  left[0]->world.taskq.fence();
5252 
5253  if (sym) {
5254  for (long i=0; i<r.dim(0); i++) {
5255  for (long j=0; j<i; j++) {
5256  TENSOR_RESULT_TYPE(T,R) sum = r(i,j)+conj(r(j,i));
5257  r(i,j) = sum;
5258  r(j,i) = conj(sum);
5259  }
5260  }
5261  }
5262  return r;
5263  }
5264 
5265  /// Return the inner product with an external function on a specified function node.
5266  /// @param[in] key Key of the function node to compute the inner product on. (the domain of integration)
5267  /// @param[in] c Tensor of coefficients for the function at the function node given by key
5268  /// @param[in] f Reference to FunctionFunctorInterface. This is the externally provided function
5269  /// @return Returns the inner product over the domain of a single function node, no guarantee of accuracy.
5270  T inner_ext_node(keyT key, tensorT c, const std::shared_ptr< FunctionFunctorInterface<T,NDIM> > f) const {
5271  tensorT fvals = tensorT(this->cdata.vk);
5272  // Compute the value of the external function at the quadrature points.
5273  fcube(key, *(f), cdata.quad_x, fvals);
5274  // Convert quadrature point values to scaling coefficients.
5275  tensorT fc = tensorT(values2coeffs(key, fvals));
5276  // Return the inner product of the two functions' scaling coefficients.
5277  return c.trace_conj(fc);
5278  }
5279 
5280  /// Call inner_ext_node recursively until convergence.
5281  /// @param[in] key Key of the function node on which to compute inner product (the domain of integration)
5282  /// @param[in] c coeffs for the function at the node given by key
5283  /// @param[in] f Reference to FunctionFunctorInterface. This is the externally provided function
5284  /// @param[in] leaf_refine boolean switch to turn on/off refinement past leaf nodes
5285  /// @param[in] old_inner the inner product on the parent function node
5286  /// @return Returns the inner product over the domain of a single function, checks for convergence.
5287  T inner_ext_recursive(keyT key, tensorT c, const std::shared_ptr< FunctionFunctorInterface<T,NDIM> > f, const bool leaf_refine, T old_inner=T(0)) const {
5288  int i = 0;
5289  tensorT c_child, inner_child;
5290  T new_inner, result = 0.0;
5291 
5292  c_child = tensorT(cdata.v2k); // tensor of child coeffs
5293  inner_child = Tensor<double>(pow(2, NDIM)); // child inner products
5294 
5295  // If old_inner is default value, assume this is the first call
5296  // and compute inner product on this node.
5297  if (old_inner == T(0)) {
5298  old_inner = inner_ext_node(key, c, f);
5299  }
5300 
5301  if (coeffs.find(key).get()->second.has_children()) {
5302  // Since the key has children and we know the func is redundant,
5303  // Iterate over all children of this compute node, computing
5304  // the inner product on each child node. new_inner will store
5305  // the sum of these, yielding a more accurate inner product.
5306  for (KeyChildIterator<NDIM> it(key); it; ++it, ++i) {
5307  const keyT& child = it.key();
5308  tensorT cc = coeffs.find(child).get()->second.coeff().full_tensor_copy();
5309  inner_child(i) = inner_ext_node(child, cc, f);
5310  }
5311  new_inner = inner_child.sum();
5312  } else if (leaf_refine) {
5313  // We need the scaling coefficients of the numerical function
5314  // at each of the children nodes. We can't use project because
5315  // there is no guarantee that the numerical function will have
5316  // a functor. Instead, since we know we are at or below the
5317  // leaf nodes, the wavelet coefficients are zero (to within the
5318  // truncate tolerance). Thus, we can use unfilter() to
5319  // get the scaling coefficients at the next level.
5320  tensorT d = tensorT(cdata.v2k);
5321  d = T(0);
5322  d(cdata.s0) = copy(c);
5323  c_child = unfilter(d);
5324 
5325  // Iterate over all children of this compute node, computing
5326  // the inner product on each child node. new_inner will store
5327  // the sum of these, yielding a more accurate inner product.
5328  for (KeyChildIterator<NDIM> it(key); it; ++it, ++i) {
5329  const keyT& child = it.key();
5330  tensorT cc = tensorT(c_child(child_patch(child)));
5331  inner_child(i) = inner_ext_node(child, cc, f);
5332  }
5333  new_inner = inner_child.sum();
5334  } else {
5335  // If we get to here, we are at the leaf nodes and the user has
5336  // specified that they do not want refinement past leaf nodes.
5337  new_inner = old_inner;
5338  }
5339 
5340  // Check for convergence. If converged...yay, we're done. If not,
5341  // call inner_ext_node_recursive on each child node and accumulate
5342  // the inner product in result.
5343  // if (std::abs(new_inner - old_inner) <= truncate_tol(thresh, key)) {
5344  if (std::abs(new_inner - old_inner) <= thresh) {
5345  result = new_inner;
5346  } else {
5347  i = 0;
5348  for (KeyChildIterator<NDIM> it(key); it; ++it, ++i) {
5349  const keyT& child = it.key();
5350  tensorT cc = tensorT(c_child(child_patch(child)));
5351  result += inner_ext_recursive(child, cc, f, leaf_refine, inner_child(i));
5352  }
5353  }
5354 
5355  return result;
5356  }
5357 
5358  struct do_inner_ext_local_ffi {
5359  const std::shared_ptr< FunctionFunctorInterface<T, NDIM> > fref;
5360  const implT * impl;
5361  const bool leaf_refine;
5362  const bool do_leaves; ///< start with leaf nodes instead of initial_level
5363 
5364  do_inner_ext_local_ffi(const std::shared_ptr< FunctionFunctorInterface<T,NDIM> > f,
5365  const implT * impl, const bool leaf_refine, const bool do_leaves)
5366  : fref(f), impl(impl), leaf_refine(leaf_refine), do_leaves(do_leaves) {};
5367 
5368  T operator()(typename dcT::const_iterator& it) const {
5369  if (do_leaves and it->second.is_leaf()) {
5370  tensorT cc = it->second.coeff().full_tensor();
5371  return impl->inner_adaptive_recursive(it->first, cc, fref, leaf_refine, T(0));
5372  } else if ((not do_leaves) and (it->first.level() == impl->initial_level)) {
5373  tensorT cc = it->second.coeff().full_tensor();
5374  return impl->inner_ext_recursive(it->first, cc, fref, leaf_refine, T(0));
5375  } else {
5376  return 0.0;
5377  }
5378  }
5379 
5380  T operator()(T a, T b) const {
5381  return (a + b);
5382  }
5383 
5384  template <typename Archive> void serialize(const Archive& ar) {
5385  throw "NOT IMPLEMENTED";
5386  }
5387  };
5388 
5389  /// Return the local part of inner product with external function ... no communication.
5390  /// @param[in] f Reference to FunctionFunctorInterface. This is the externally provided function
5391  /// @param[in] leaf_refine boolean switch to turn on/off refinement past leaf nodes
5392  /// @return Returns local part of the inner product, i.e. over the domain of all function nodes on this compute node.
5393  T inner_ext_local(const std::shared_ptr< FunctionFunctorInterface<T,NDIM> > f, const bool leaf_refine) const {
5394  typedef Range<typename dcT::const_iterator> rangeT;
5395 
5396  return world.taskq.reduce<T, rangeT, do_inner_ext_local_ffi>(rangeT(coeffs.begin(),coeffs.end()),
5397  do_inner_ext_local_ffi(f, this, leaf_refine, false));
5398  }
5399 
5400  /// Return the local part of inner product with external function ... no communication.
5401  /// @param[in] f Reference to FunctionFunctorInterface. This is the externally provided function
5402  /// @param[in] leaf_refine boolean switch to turn on/off refinement past leaf nodes
5403  /// @return Returns local part of the inner product, i.e. over the domain of all function nodes on this compute node.
5404  T inner_adaptive_local(const std::shared_ptr< FunctionFunctorInterface<T,NDIM> > f, const bool leaf_refine) const {
5405  typedef Range<typename dcT::const_iterator> rangeT;
5406 
5407  return world.taskq.reduce<T, rangeT, do_inner_ext_local_ffi>(rangeT(coeffs.begin(),coeffs.end()),
5408  do_inner_ext_local_ffi(f, this, leaf_refine, true));
5409  }
5410 
5411  /// Call inner_ext_node recursively until convergence.
5412  /// @param[in] key Key of the function node on which to compute inner product (the domain of integration)
5413  /// @param[in] c coeffs for the function at the node given by key
5414  /// @param[in] f Reference to FunctionFunctorInterface. This is the externally provided function
5415  /// @param[in] leaf_refine boolean switch to turn on/off refinement past leaf nodes
5416  /// @param[in] old_inner the inner product on the parent function node
5417  /// @return Returns the inner product over the domain of a single function, checks for convergence.
5418  T inner_adaptive_recursive(keyT key, const tensorT& c,
5419  const std::shared_ptr< FunctionFunctorInterface<T,NDIM> > f,
5420  const bool leaf_refine, T old_inner=T(0)) const {
5421 
5422  // the inner product in the current node
5423  old_inner = inner_ext_node(key, c, f);
5424  T result=0.0;
5425 
5426  // the inner product in the child nodes
5427 
5428  // compute the sum coefficients of the MRA function
5429  tensorT d = tensorT(cdata.v2k);
5430  d = T(0);
5431  d(cdata.s0) = copy(c);
5432  tensorT c_child = unfilter(d);
5433 
5434  // compute the inner product in the child nodes
5435  T new_inner=0.0; // child inner products
5436  for (KeyChildIterator<NDIM> it(key); it; ++it) {
5437  const keyT& child = it.key();
5438  tensorT cc = tensorT(c_child(child_patch(child)));
5439  new_inner+= inner_ext_node(child, cc, f);
5440  }
5441 
5442  // continue recursion if needed
5443  const double tol=truncate_tol(thresh,key);
5444  if (leaf_refine and (std::abs(new_inner - old_inner) > tol)) {
5445  for (KeyChildIterator<NDIM> it(key); it; ++it) {
5446  const keyT& child = it.key();
5447  tensorT cc = tensorT(c_child(child_patch(child)));
5448  result += inner_adaptive_recursive(child, cc, f, leaf_refine, T(0));
5449  }
5450  } else {
5451  result = new_inner;
5452  }
5453  return result;
5454 
5455  }
5456 
5457 
5458  /// Return the gaxpy product with an external function on a specified
5459  /// function node.
5460  /// @param[in] key Key of the function node on which to compute gaxpy
5461  /// @param[in] lc Tensor of coefficients for the function at the
5462  /// function node given by key
5463  /// @param[in] f Pointer to function of type T that takes coordT
5464  /// arguments. This is the externally provided function and
5465  /// the right argument of gaxpy.
5466  /// @param[in] alpha prefactor of c Tensor for gaxpy
5467  /// @param[in] beta prefactor of fcoeffs for gaxpy
5468  /// @return Returns coefficient tensor of the gaxpy product at specified
5469  /// key, no guarantee of accuracy.
5470  template <typename L>
5471  tensorT gaxpy_ext_node(keyT key, Tensor<L> lc, T (*f)(const coordT&), T alpha, T beta) const {
5472  // Compute the value of external function at the quadrature points.
5473  tensorT fvals = madness::fcube(key, f, cdata.quad_x);
5474  // Convert quadrature point values to scaling coefficients.
5475  tensorT fcoeffs = values2coeffs(key, fvals);
5476  // Return the inner product of the two functions' scaling coeffs.
5477  tensorT c2 = copy(lc);
5478  c2.gaxpy(alpha, fcoeffs, beta);
5479  return c2;
5480  }
5481 
5482  /// Return out of place gaxpy using recursive descent.
5483  /// @param[in] key Key of the function node on which to compute gaxpy
5484  /// @param[in] left FunctionImpl, left argument of gaxpy
5485  /// @param[in] lcin coefficients of left at this node
5486  /// @param[in] c coefficients of gaxpy product at this node
5487  /// @param[in] f pointer to function of type T that takes coordT
5488  /// arguments. This is the externally provided function and
5489  /// the right argument of gaxpy.
5490  /// @param[in] alpha prefactor of left argument for gaxpy
5491  /// @param[in] beta prefactor of right argument for gaxpy
5492  /// @param[in] tol convergence tolerance...when the norm of the gaxpy's
5493  /// difference coefficients is less than tol, we are done.
5494  template <typename L>
5495  void gaxpy_ext_recursive(const keyT& key, const FunctionImpl<L,NDIM>* left,
5496  Tensor<L> lcin, tensorT c, T (*f)(const coordT&),
5497  T alpha, T beta, double tol, bool below_leaf) {
5498  typedef typename FunctionImpl<L,NDIM>::dcT::const_iterator literT;
5499 
5500  // If we haven't yet reached the leaf level, check whether the
5501  // current key is a leaf node of left. If so, set below_leaf to true
5502  // and continue. If not, make this a parent, recur down, return.
5503  if (not below_leaf) {
5504  bool left_leaf = left->coeffs.find(key).get()->second.is_leaf();
5505  if (left_leaf) {
5506  below_leaf = true;
5507  } else {
5508  this->coeffs.replace(key, nodeT(coeffT(), true));
5509  for (KeyChildIterator<NDIM> it(key); it; ++it) {
5510  const keyT& child = it.key();
5511  woT::task(left->coeffs.owner(child), &implT:: template gaxpy_ext_recursive<L>,
5512  child, left, Tensor<L>(), tensorT(), f, alpha, beta, tol, below_leaf);
5513  }
5514  return;
5515  }
5516  }
5517 
5518  // Compute left's coefficients if not provided
5519  Tensor<L> lc = lcin;
5520  if (lc.size() == 0) {
5521  literT it = left->coeffs.find(key).get();
5522  MADNESS_ASSERT(it != left->coeffs.end());
5523  if (it->second.has_coeff())
5524  lc = it->second.coeff().full_tensor_copy();
5525  }
5526 
5527  // Compute this node's coefficients if not provided in function call
5528  if (c.size() == 0) {
5529  c = gaxpy_ext_node(key, lc, f, alpha, beta);
5530  }
5531 
5532  // We need the scaling coefficients of the numerical function at
5533  // each of the children nodes. We can't use project because there
5534  // is no guarantee that the numerical function will have a functor.
5535  // Instead, since we know we are at or below the leaf nodes, the
5536  // wavelet coefficients are zero (to within the truncate tolerance).
5537  // Thus, we can use unfilter() to get the scaling coefficients at
5538  // the next level.
5539  Tensor<L> lc_child = Tensor<L>(cdata.v2k); // left's child coeffs
5540  Tensor<L> ld = Tensor<L>(cdata.v2k);
5541  ld = L(0);
5542  ld(cdata.s0) = copy(lc);
5543  lc_child = unfilter(ld);
5544 
5545  // Iterate over children of this node,
5546  // storing the gaxpy coeffs in c_child
5547  tensorT c_child = tensorT(cdata.v2k); // tensor of child coeffs
5548  for (KeyChildIterator<NDIM> it(key); it; ++it) {
5549  const keyT& child = it.key();
5550  tensorT lcoeff = tensorT(lc_child(child_patch(child)));
5551  c_child(child_patch(child)) = gaxpy_ext_node(child, lcoeff, f, alpha, beta);
5552  }
5553 
5554  // Compute the difference coefficients to test for convergence.
5555  tensorT d = tensorT(cdata.v2k);
5556  d = filter(c_child);
5557  // Filter returns both s and d coefficients, so set scaling
5558  // coefficient part of d to 0 so that we take only the
5559  // norm of the difference coefficients.
5560  d(cdata.s0) = T(0);
5561  double dnorm = d.normf();
5562 
5563  // Small d.normf means we've reached a good level of resolution
5564  // Store the coefficients and return.
5565  if (dnorm <= truncate_tol(tol,key)) {
5566  this->coeffs.replace(key, nodeT(coeffT(c,targs), false));
5567  } else {
5568  // Otherwise, make this a parent node and recur down
5569  this->coeffs.replace(key, nodeT(coeffT(), true)); // Interior node
5570 
5571  for (KeyChildIterator<NDIM> it(key); it; ++it) {
5572  const keyT& child = it.key();
5573  tensorT child_coeff = tensorT(c_child(child_patch(child)));
5574  tensorT left_coeff = tensorT(lc_child(child_patch(child)));
5575  woT::task(left->coeffs.owner(child), &implT:: template gaxpy_ext_recursive<L>,
5576  child, left, left_coeff, child_coeff, f, alpha, beta, tol, below_leaf);
5577  }
5578  }
5579  }
5580 
5581  template <typename L>
5582  void gaxpy_ext(const FunctionImpl<L,NDIM>* left, T (*f)(const coordT&), T alpha, T beta, double tol, bool fence) {
5583  if (world.rank() == coeffs.owner(cdata.key0))
5584  gaxpy_ext_recursive<L> (cdata.key0, left, Tensor<L>(), tensorT(), f, alpha, beta, tol, false);
5585  if (fence)
5586  world.gop.fence();
5587  }
5588 
5589  /// project the low-dim function g on the hi-dim function f: result(x) = <this(x,y) | g(y)>
5590 
5591  /// invoked by the hi-dim function, a function of NDIM+LDIM
5592 
5593  /// Upon return, result matches this, with contributions on all scales
5594  /// @param[in] result lo-dim function of NDIM-LDIM \todo Should this be param[out]?
5595  /// @param[in] gimpl lo-dim function of LDIM
5596  /// @param[in] dim over which dimensions to be integrated: 0..LDIM or LDIM..LDIM+NDIM-1
5597  template<size_t LDIM>
5598  void project_out(FunctionImpl<T,NDIM-LDIM>* result, const FunctionImpl<T,LDIM>* gimpl,
5599  const int dim, const bool fence) {
5600 
5601  const keyT& key0=cdata.key0;
5602 
5603  if (world.rank() == coeffs.owner(key0)) {
5604 
5605  // coeff_op will accumulate the result
5606  typedef project_out_op<LDIM> coeff_opT;
5607  coeff_opT coeff_op(this,result,CoeffTracker<T,LDIM>(gimpl),dim);
5608 
5609  // don't do anything on this -- coeff_op will accumulate into result
5610  typedef noop<T,NDIM> apply_opT;
5611  apply_opT apply_op;
5612 
5613  woT::task(world.rank(), &implT:: template forward_traverse<coeff_opT,apply_opT>,
5614  coeff_op, apply_op, cdata.key0);
5615 
5616  }
5617  if (fence) world.gop.fence();
5618 
5619  }
5620 
5621 
5622  /// project the low-dim function g on the hi-dim function f: result(x) = <f(x,y) | g(y)>
5623  template<size_t LDIM>
5624  struct project_out_op {
5625  bool randomize() const {return false;}
5626 
5627  typedef project_out_op<LDIM> this_type;
5628  typedef CoeffTracker<T,LDIM> ctL;
5629  typedef FunctionImpl<T,NDIM-LDIM> implL1;
5630  typedef std::pair<bool,coeffT> argT;
5631 
5632  const implT* fimpl; ///< the hi dim function f
5633  mutable implL1* result; ///< the low dim result function
5634  ctL iag; ///< the low dim function g
5635  int dim; ///< 0: project 0..LDIM-1, 1: project LDIM..NDIM-1
5636 
5637  // ctor
5638  project_out_op() {}
5639  project_out_op(const implT* fimpl, implL1* result, const ctL& iag, const int dim)
5640  : fimpl(fimpl), result(result), iag(iag), dim(dim) {}
5641  project_out_op(const project_out_op& other)
5642  : fimpl(other.fimpl), result(other.result), iag(other.iag), dim(other.dim) {}
5643 
5644 
5645  /// do the actual contraction
5646  Future<argT> operator()(const Key<NDIM>& key) const {
5647 
5648  Key<LDIM> key1,key2,dest;
5649  key.break_apart(key1,key2);
5650 
5651  // make the right coefficients
5652  coeffT gcoeff;
5653  if (dim==0) {
5654  gcoeff=iag.get_impl()->parent_to_child(iag.coeff(),iag.key(),key1);
5655  dest=key2;
5656  }
5657  if (dim==1) {
5658  gcoeff=iag.get_impl()->parent_to_child(iag.coeff(),iag.key(),key2);
5659  dest=key1;
5660  }
5661 
5662  MADNESS_ASSERT(fimpl->get_coeffs().probe(key)); // must be local!
5663  const nodeT& fnode=fimpl->get_coeffs().find(key).get()->second;
5664  const coeffT& fcoeff=fnode.coeff();
5665 
5666  // fast return if possible
5667  if (fcoeff.has_no_data() or gcoeff.has_no_data())
5668  return Future<argT> (argT(fnode.is_leaf(),coeffT()));;
5669 
5670  // let's specialize for the time being on SVD tensors for f and full tensors of half dim for g
5671  MADNESS_ASSERT(gcoeff.tensor_type()==TT_FULL);
5672  MADNESS_ASSERT(fcoeff.tensor_type()==TT_2D);
5673  const tensorT gtensor=gcoeff.full_tensor();
5674  tensorT final(result->cdata.vk);
5675 
5676  const int otherdim=(dim+1)%2;
5677  const int k=fcoeff.dim(0);
5678  std::vector<Slice> s(fcoeff.config().dim_per_vector()+1,_);
5679 
5680  // do the actual contraction
5681  for (int r=0; r<fcoeff.rank(); ++r) {
5682  s[0]=Slice(r,r);
5683  const tensorT contracted_tensor=fcoeff.config().ref_vector(dim)(s).reshape(k,k,k);
5684  const tensorT other_tensor=fcoeff.config().ref_vector(otherdim)(s).reshape(k,k,k);
5685  const double ovlp= gtensor.trace_conj(contracted_tensor);
5686  const double fac=ovlp * fcoeff.config().weights(r);
5687  final+=fac*other_tensor;
5688  }
5689 
5690  // accumulate the result
5691  result->coeffs.task(dest, &FunctionNode<T,LDIM>::accumulate2, final, result->coeffs, dest, TaskAttributes::hipri());
5692 
5693  return Future<argT> (argT(fnode.is_leaf(),coeffT()));
5694  }
5695 
5696  this_type make_child(const keyT& child) const {
5697  Key<LDIM> key1,key2;
5698  child.break_apart(key1,key2);
5699  const Key<LDIM> gkey = (dim==0) ? key1 : key2;
5700 
5701  return this_type(fimpl,result,iag.make_child(gkey),dim);
5702  }
5703 
5704  /// retrieve the coefficients (parent coeffs might be remote)
5705  Future<this_type> activate() const {
5706  Future<ctL> g1=iag.activate();
5707  return result->world.taskq.add(detail::wrap_mem_fn(*const_cast<this_type *> (this),
5708  &this_type::forward_ctor),fimpl,result,g1,dim);
5709  }
5710 
5711  /// taskq-compatible ctor
5712  this_type forward_ctor(const implT* fimpl1, implL1* result1, const ctL& iag1, const int dim1) {
5713  return this_type(fimpl1,result1,iag1,dim1);
5714  }
5715 
5716  template <typename Archive> void serialize(const Archive& ar) {
5717  ar & result & iag & fimpl & dim;
5718  }
5719 
5720  };
5721 
5722 
5723  /// project the low-dim function g on the hi-dim function f: this(x) = <f(x,y) | g(y)>
5724 
5725  /// invoked by result, a function of NDIM
5726 
5727  /// @param[in] f hi-dim function of LDIM+NDIM
5728  /// @param[in] g lo-dim function of LDIM
5729  /// @param[in] dim over which dimensions to be integrated: 0..LDIM or LDIM..LDIM+NDIM-1
5730  template<size_t LDIM>
5731  void project_out2(const FunctionImpl<T,LDIM+NDIM>* f, const FunctionImpl<T,LDIM>* g, const int dim) {
5732 
5733  typedef std::pair< keyT,coeffT > pairT;
5734  typedef typename FunctionImpl<T,NDIM+LDIM>::dcT::const_iterator fiterator;
5735 
5736  // loop over all nodes of hi-dim f, compute the inner products with all
5737  // appropriate nodes of g, and accumulate in result
5738  fiterator end = f->get_coeffs().end();
5739  for (fiterator it=f->get_coeffs().begin(); it!=end; ++it) {
5740  const Key<LDIM+NDIM> key=it->first;
5741  const FunctionNode<T,LDIM+NDIM> fnode=it->second;
5742  const coeffT& fcoeff=fnode.coeff();
5743 
5744  if (fnode.is_leaf() and fcoeff.has_data()) {
5745 
5746  // break key into particle: over key1 will be summed, over key2 will be
5747  // accumulated, or vice versa, depending on dim
5748  if (dim==0) {
5749  Key<NDIM> key1;
5750  Key<LDIM> key2;
5751  key.break_apart(key1,key2);
5752 
5753  Future<pairT> result;
5754  // sock_it_to_me(key1, result.remote_ref(world));
5755  g->task(coeffs.owner(key1), &implT::sock_it_to_me, key1, result.remote_ref(world), TaskAttributes::hipri());
5756  woT::task(world.rank(),&implT:: template do_project_out<LDIM>,fcoeff,result,key1,key2,dim);
5757 
5758  } else if (dim==1) {
5759  Key<LDIM> key1;
5760  Key<NDIM> key2;
5761  key.break_apart(key1,key2);
5762 
5763  Future<pairT> result;
5764  // sock_it_to_me(key2, result.remote_ref(world));
5765  g->task(coeffs.owner(key2), &implT::sock_it_to_me, key2, result.remote_ref(world), TaskAttributes::hipri());
5766  woT::task(world.rank(),&implT:: template do_project_out<LDIM>,fcoeff,result,key2,key1,dim);
5767 
5768  } else {
5769  MADNESS_EXCEPTION("confused dim in project_out",1);
5770  }
5771  }
5772  }
5773  this->compressed=false;
5774  this->nonstandard=false;
5775  this->redundant=true;
5776  }
5777 
5778 
5779  /// compute the inner product of two nodes of only some dimensions and accumulate on result
5780 
5781  /// invoked by result
5782  /// @param[in] fcoeff coefficients of high dimension LDIM+NDIM
5783  /// @param[in] gpair key and coeffs of low dimension LDIM (possibly a parent node)
5784  /// @param[in] gkey key of actual low dim node (possibly the same as gpair.first, iff gnode exists)
5785  /// @param[in] dest destination node for the result
5786  /// @param[in] dim which dimensions should be contracted: 0..LDIM-1 or LDIM..NDIM+LDIM-1
5787  template<size_t LDIM>
5788  void do_project_out(const coeffT& fcoeff, const std::pair<keyT,coeffT> gpair, const keyT& gkey,
5789  const Key<NDIM>& dest, const int dim) const {
5790 
5791  const coeffT gcoeff=parent_to_child(gpair.second,gpair.first,gkey);
5792 
5793  // fast return if possible
5794  if (fcoeff.has_no_data() or gcoeff.has_no_data()) return;
5795 
5796  // let's specialize for the time being on SVD tensors for f and full tensors of half dim for g
5797  MADNESS_ASSERT(gcoeff.tensor_type()==TT_FULL);
5798  MADNESS_ASSERT(fcoeff.tensor_type()==TT_2D);
5799  const tensorT gtensor=gcoeff.full_tensor();
5800  tensorT result(cdata.vk);
5801 
5802  const int otherdim=(dim+1)%2;
5803  const int k=fcoeff.dim(0);
5804  std::vector<Slice> s(fcoeff.config().dim_per_vector()+1,_);
5805 
5806  // do the actual contraction
5807  for (int r=0; r<fcoeff.rank(); ++r) {
5808  s[0]=Slice(r,r);
5809  const tensorT contracted_tensor=fcoeff.config().ref_vector(dim)(s).reshape(k,k,k);
5810  const tensorT other_tensor=fcoeff.config().ref_vector(otherdim)(s).reshape(k,k,k);
5811  const double ovlp= gtensor.trace_conj(contracted_tensor);
5812  const double fac=ovlp * fcoeff.config().weights(r);
5813  result+=fac*other_tensor;
5814  }
5815 
5816  // accumulate the result
5817  coeffs.task(dest, &nodeT::accumulate2, result, coeffs, dest, TaskAttributes::hipri());
5818  }
5819 
5820 
5821 
5822 
5823  /// Returns the maximum local depth of the tree ... no communications.
5824  std::size_t max_local_depth() const;
5825 
5826 
5827  /// Returns the maximum depth of the tree ... collective ... global sum/broadcast
5828  std::size_t max_depth() const;
5829 
5830  /// Returns the max number of nodes on a processor
5831  std::size_t max_nodes() const;
5832 
5833  /// Returns the min number of nodes on a processor
5834  std::size_t min_nodes() const;
5835 
5836  /// Returns the size of the tree structure of the function ... collective global sum
5837  std::size_t tree_size() const;
5838 
5839  /// Returns the number of coefficients in the function ... collective global sum
5840  std::size_t size() const;
5841 
5842  /// Returns the number of coefficients in the function ... collective global sum
5843  std::size_t real_size() const;
5844 
5845  /// print tree size and size
5846  void print_size(const std::string name) const;
5847 
5848  /// print the number of configurations per node
5849  void print_stats() const;
5850 
5851  /// In-place scale by a constant
5852  void scale_inplace(const T q, bool fence);
5853 
5854  /// Out-of-place scale by a constant
5855  template <typename Q, typename F>
5856  void scale_oop(const Q q, const FunctionImpl<F,NDIM>& f, bool fence) {
5857  typedef typename FunctionImpl<F,NDIM>::nodeT fnodeT;
5858  typedef typename FunctionImpl<F,NDIM>::dcT fdcT;
5859  typename fdcT::const_iterator end = f.coeffs.end();
5860  for (typename fdcT::const_iterator it=f.coeffs.begin(); it!=end; ++it) {
5861  const keyT& key = it->first;
5862  const fnodeT& node = it->second;
5863 
5864  if (node.has_coeff()) {
5865  coeffs.replace(key,nodeT(node.coeff()*q,node.has_children()));
5866  }
5867  else {
5868  coeffs.replace(key,nodeT(coeffT(),node.has_children()));
5869  }
5870  }
5871  if (fence)
5872  world.gop.fence();
5873  }
5874  };
5875 
5876  namespace archive {
5877  template <class Archive, class T, std::size_t NDIM>
5878  struct ArchiveLoadImpl<Archive,const FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>*> {
5879  static void load(const Archive& ar, const FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>*& ptr) {
5880  bool exists=false;
5881  ar & exists;
5882  if (exists) {
5883  uniqueidT id;
5884  ar & id;
5885  World* world = World::world_from_id(id.get_world_id());
5886  MADNESS_ASSERT(world);
5887  ptr = static_cast< const FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>*>(world->ptr_from_id< WorldObject< FunctionImpl<T,NDIM> > >(id));
5888  if (!ptr)
5889  MADNESS_EXCEPTION("FunctionImpl: remote operation attempting to use a locally uninitialized object",0);
5890  } else {
5891  ptr=nullptr;
5892  }
5893  }
5894  };
5895 
5896  template <class Archive, class T, std::size_t NDIM>
5897  struct ArchiveStoreImpl<Archive,const FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>*> {
5898  static void store(const Archive& ar, const FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>*const& ptr) {
5899  bool exists=(ptr) ? true : false;
5900  ar & exists;
5901  if (exists) ar & ptr->id();
5902  }
5903  };
5904 
5905  template <class Archive, class T, std::size_t NDIM>
5906  struct ArchiveLoadImpl<Archive, FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>*> {
5907  static void load(const Archive& ar, FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>*& ptr) {
5908  bool exists=false;
5909  ar & exists;
5910  if (exists) {
5911  uniqueidT id;
5912  ar & id;
5913  World* world = World::world_from_id(id.get_world_id());
5914  MADNESS_ASSERT(world);
5915  ptr = static_cast< FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>*>(world->ptr_from_id< WorldObject< FunctionImpl<T,NDIM> > >(id));
5916  if (!ptr)
5917  MADNESS_EXCEPTION("FunctionImpl: remote operation attempting to use a locally uninitialized object",0);
5918  } else {
5919  ptr=nullptr;
5920  }
5921  }
5922  };
5923 
5924  template <class Archive, class T, std::size_t NDIM>
5925  struct ArchiveStoreImpl<Archive, FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>*> {
5926  static void store(const Archive& ar, FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>*const& ptr) {
5927  bool exists=(ptr) ? true : false;
5928  ar & exists;
5929  if (exists) ar & ptr->id();
5930  // ar & ptr->id();
5931  }
5932  };
5933 
5934  template <class Archive, class T, std::size_t NDIM>
5935  struct ArchiveLoadImpl<Archive, std::shared_ptr<const FunctionImpl<T,NDIM> > > {
5936  static void load(const Archive& ar, std::shared_ptr<const FunctionImpl<T,NDIM> >& ptr) {
5937  const FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>* f = nullptr;
5938  ArchiveLoadImpl<Archive, const FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>*>::load(ar, f);
5939  ptr.reset(f, [] (const FunctionImpl<T,NDIM> *p_) -> void {});
5940  }
5941  };
5942 
5943  template <class Archive, class T, std::size_t NDIM>
5944  struct ArchiveStoreImpl<Archive, std::shared_ptr<const FunctionImpl<T,NDIM> > > {
5945  static void store(const Archive& ar, const std::shared_ptr<const FunctionImpl<T,NDIM> >& ptr) {
5946  ArchiveStoreImpl<Archive, const FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>*>::store(ar, ptr.get());
5947  }
5948  };
5949 
5950  template <class Archive, class T, std::size_t NDIM>
5951  struct ArchiveLoadImpl<Archive, std::shared_ptr<FunctionImpl<T,NDIM> > > {
5952  static void load(const Archive& ar, std::shared_ptr<FunctionImpl<T,NDIM> >& ptr) {
5953  FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>* f = nullptr;
5954  ArchiveLoadImpl<Archive, FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>*>::load(ar, f);
5955  ptr.reset(f, [] (FunctionImpl<T,NDIM> *p_) -> void {});
5956  }
5957  };
5958 
5959  template <class Archive, class T, std::size_t NDIM>
5960  struct ArchiveStoreImpl<Archive, std::shared_ptr<FunctionImpl<T,NDIM> > > {
5961  static void store(const Archive& ar, const std::shared_ptr<FunctionImpl<T,NDIM> >& ptr) {
5962  ArchiveStoreImpl<Archive, FunctionImpl<T,NDIM>*>::store(ar, ptr.get());
5963  }
5964  };
5965  }
5966 
5967 }
5968
